attributes.comment:
I am writing as a post-adoptive parent of two daughters from Ukraine on
3/16/2006. It is very important for the Government to understand the financial
hardships placed on a family before, during and after an adoption. My husband
and I started out upper income family with a nice savings a house and pleasant
success. After our second daughter arrived home, six months after our adoption,
we had lost nearly everything financially and unexpectedly-- although I would
not hesitate to do it all over again, because the children around the world need
families like us, they need hope.

Because of political chaos and my daughter being born in a country other than
Ukraine (Russia) she had to spend six months abandoned by the U.S., her new
home, her country of Ukraine and her birth country. She was not legally allowed
in the U.S. for lack of a birth certificate Russia refused to provide and was
not allowed to stay in the orphanage because she had been legally adopted. We
were made to pay a private nanny for her stay.

During the time in between I was terminated from my job for my extended stay of
5 weeks in Ukraine and NOT covered by FMLA with NO protection from our
government. As the year progressed we went from stable to near bankrupt from the
steep adoption feed to unthinkable expenses to reunite our family on little to
no income and no protection..

I am writing you today, not for pity but for advocacy for the children. It is
hard enough to find funds to adopt for most families and I think back to the
days when we weren't bothered by the expenses and were "better off" and wonder
what would have been if the fees were written as they were. With international
governments and the RADA now causing steep inclines in the cost of adoptions in
every facet, I must plead that you don't impose unreasonable and steep rate
increases. These are families and the loss of potential children's hope.

Please take a moment to focus on the real problems with immigration practices
and issues within our government that allow families to lose their jobs for
adopting children?

Sincerely,
Shelley Schadowsky

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
